results.title: Mississippi masala [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Mira Nair, Michael Nozik, Film Four International and SCS Films
results.brief_description: A refreshingly tender film about race relations in the United States that manages to be both intelligent and complex. Mina (Roshan Seth) is an Indian woman whose family fled Uganda during the rule of Idi Amin. She falls in love with Demetrius (Denzel Washington), an African-American who is challenged by the traditions of her Indian background. She in turn has to fight against her family’s fears and racism. Without histrionics this film paints a picture of small-town Americana that is rich and diverse. A wonderful comic love story with excellent performances.

results.title: Riff raff [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Ken Loach, Sally Hibbin, Channel Four, Newvision Films and Parallax Pictures
results.brief_description: Follows the fortunes (and misfortunes) of Stevie, a young labourer fresh out of jail. He soon finds work on a building site, converting an old hospital into luxury apartments. Stevie finds support and fellowship from his fellow workers, a melting pot of men from different parts of England. Conditions on the site are lousy, as well as unsafe, and with no help from the developers, Stevie along with his mates take matters into their own hands.

results.title: Solaris (2003)
results.creator_credit: Steven Soderbergh, James Cameron, Jon Landau, Rae Sanchini, Lightstorm Entertainment and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Pyschologist Dr. Chris Kelvin (George Clooney) has been assigned to investigate the mysterious events occurring aboard a space station orbiting the planet Solaris. He discovers that the two surviving members on the station are struggling with their sanity and that the planet itself is a living organism with the power of entering human consciousness and recreating lost loves. Chris Kelvin is haunted by the visitation of his dead wife Khari (Natascha McElhone). This film is a remake of the more philosophical version by Andrei Tarkovsky released in 1972, and is more a personal investigation into the themes of memory and regret rather than spirituality and science. Beautiful production design lends itself to the dreamy and sensual pace. Based on the novel by Stanislaw Lem, this version is written and directed by Steven Soderbergh. Cast includes Jeremy Davies, Viola Davis and Ulrich Tukur.

constellations_other.name: Returning to Solaris
constellations_other.description: Stanislaw Lem’s novel Solaris (1961) tells the haunting story of a space research expedition’s encounter with a sentient ocean planet. Here we look at how different artists have responded to, remixed and referenced Solaris over film, television, and videogames.

results.title: Le Divorce
results.creator_credit: James Ivory, Ismail Merchant, Michael Schiffer, Fox Searchlight Pictures, Merchant Ivory Productions and Radar Pictures
results.brief_description: A stellar ensemble cast in this romantic drama/comedy about a cultural clash between a French husband, his American wife (Naomi Watts) and her sister (Kate Hudson). From the creative team of Merchant Ivory comes this study of romantic relationships, wealth and culture. Based on the novel by Diane Johnson. Cast includes Glenn Close, Stephen Fry, Leslie Caron and Stockard Channing.

results.title: 28 days later = twenty eight days later
results.creator_credit: Danny Boyle, Andrew Macdonald, DNA (Korea), Film Council and Fox Searchlight Pictures
results.brief_description: Upon waking after being in a coma for 28 days, bicycle courier Jim (Cillian Murphy) finds a completely different world. London is empty except for the virally infected zombies that want to murder everyone - and there aren’t many people left. Jim is rescued by Selena (Naomie Harris) who proves to be a strong and fearless survivor. The virus is passed on through blood and devastates within seconds, driving the infected into a murderous rage that essentially threatens human existence. But is the virus all that endangers the survivors? End-of-the-world survival tale done in a dark and sombre mood - a science-fiction horror story from the director of “Trainspotting” and “The Beach”, Danny Boyle. Cast includes Christopher Eccleston, Megan Burns and Brendan Gleeson. SOME SCENES MAY DISTURB.

results.title: Punch-drunk love = Punch drunk love
results.creator_credit: Paul Thomas Anderson, Daniel Lupi, Joanne Sellar, Columbia, New Line Cinema and Revolution Studios
results.brief_description: This is not a typical Adam Sandler comedy. Barry Egan (Sandler) is a novelty business owner who has seven sisters and is looking for love, (even trying phone sex once) but love finds him, sending his very ordered life upside down. Watching “Punch-drunk love” you find a mix of dark humour and seedy characters, coupled with violent behaviour and social dysfunction - but it’s also a romance with colour, mood and music that carries you along and makes you hope for a happy ending. Written and directed by Paul Thomas Anderson, winner of Best Director 2002 Cannes Film Festival for this disquieting film. Cast includes Emily Watson, Philip Seymour Hoffman and Luis Guzman.

results.title: Walking on Water
results.creator_credit: Tony Ayres, Liz Watts and SBS Independent
results.brief_description: An impressive Australian debut feature from Tony Ayres about a young man’s death and the aftermath for his friends and family.

constellations_other.name: Tony Ayres
constellations_other.description: Charts the acclaimed career of Tony Ayres through his work in film and TV.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Tony Ayres, Liz Watts and SBS Independent
results.description: Impressive Australian debut feature from Tony Ayres about a young man’s death and the aftermath for his friends and family. Gavin is a gay man living in Sydney when he succumbs to illness; his two best friends, Anna and Charlie, who assist his death in its final stages, grieve inconsolably, blocking their pain and memories with drugs, alcohol and sex. Whilst Charlie’s relationship with his boyfriend sours, Anna embarks on an affair, whilst shifting into controlling over-drive. This puts her in conflict with Gavin’s mother, who finds her role usurped. Despite the morbid subject matter “Walking on water” relishes in gallows humour, showing that even in death, there is life. Brilliant central performances from Vince Colosimo and Maria Theodorakis, coupled with intelligent scripting make this a memorable experience.
description_for_label: Impressive Australian debut feature from Tony Ayres about a young man’s death and the aftermath for his friends and family. results.title: Swimming pool
results.creator_credit: Francois Ozon, Marc Missonnier, Olivier Delbosc, Fidelite Productions, Foz, France2 Cinema and Gimages Films
results.brief_description: In his first film in English, writer/director Francois Ozon directs two actors that have worked with him before - Charlotte Rampling (“Under The Sand”) and Ludivine Sagnier (“8 Women”). Enlisting performances that essentially carry the narrative, Ozon’s preference for films dealing with psychological manipulation is evident with this film. Sarah Morton (Rampling) is an English crime writer who jaded by her monetary success and fame seeks out her publisher John Bosload (Charles Dance) and a morning whiskey to help cheer her up. He suggests she uses his holiday house in France for a break and possibly some inspiration for her next novel in a detective series she has been writing. Her time in France seems to be just what she needs, until a visit by Bosload’s estranged daughter Julie (Sagnier) throws her staid and orderly self into disarray. Sexually provocative and physically beautiful, Julie becomes her new fascination and the two women form a bond when murder and muse become intertwined in their summer idyll by the swimming pool. Charlotte Rampling was winner of Best Actress from the European Film Academy in 2003 for her role of Morton. Official selection Cannes 2003. Cast includes Marc Fayolle and Jean-Marie Lamour.

results.title: Secretary
results.creator_credit: Steven Shainberg, Amy Hobby, Andrew Fierberg, Double A Films and Lions Gate Films
results.brief_description: A secretarial role at a law firm is a first job for a young girl with expert typing skills and having just left a hostel for people with mental illness, the girl also has a troubled home life and a history of self-mutilation. A look at contemporary sexual politics where ‘coming out’ has new meaning. The secretary, Lee Holloway (Maggie Gyllenhaal), reveals to her family and friends the need for her masochistic relationship with her boss E. Edward Grey (James Spader) and their special kind of love. The kind of office politics this film contains would horrify any Human Resources department! Based on the story “Secretary” by Mary Gaitskill. Cast includes Jeremy Davies. Contains Sex Scenes.

results.title: Adaptation
results.creator_credit: Spike Jonze, Edward Saxon, Jonathan Demme, Vincent Landay, Columbia and Intermedia
results.brief_description: From the creators of “Being John Malkovich” - director Spike Jonze and screenwriter Charlie Kaufman - comes the strangely twisted tale of woe of a screenwriter given the task of adapting a novel to the screen. In a desperate struggle, he actually writes himself (and his twin brother) into the story and reality and fiction start to blur, creating some dramatic and at times, comic situations. Cast includes Nicholas Cage, Meryl Streep and Chris Cooper (Academy Award Winner Best Supporting Actor for this role). Screenplay by Charlie and Donald Kaufman. “Adaptation” is also winner of two Golden Globe Awards. Based on the book “The Orchard Thief” by Susan Orlean.
